message.body: ￼I bought myself a job interview/adult watch. 42% off!
Very nice. If you want, I can teach you how to tell time on that kind of watch. ;b
I'm gonna have to get used to it
So, had u heard of Aaron Beck?
Btw the symbol at end of ur last txt was just a square
Oh no! But you have an iPhone! They're smileys. The name was familiar. Thanks for the email! They don't look like they do research.
We used to call our parents square (not cool)

My point is: beyond a full- time job, esp if close by, it's worth getting to know them & their work & for them to [already] know u & your interest/capabilities. Networking. Possibilities of non- research work in that environment
They do computer work, logistics, planning, communications, etc. important to learn all that. Think of what Ali Cocuzzo & Wendy do. Those extra skills can make ur resume shine even more brightly

Even volunteering or coattailing goes on that resume. And sometimes the hirer will choose a familiar name, or recall that 4 yrs ago u took the initiative to explore their accomplishments & offerings/services

When I moved from RI to NYC, even though I wanted to work in health care, I accepted the offer to go w a hotel executive to a local reception/short conference. I mingled, listened, shared my hotel experience n interest, collected bus. cards & wrote down details after.

When u visit or talk w anybody, talk itself up offer to email ur resume. They might remember u for ur green eyes or be impressed that u know about their work. U just never know. Or their spouse or friend could be a grad school dean or the grant-assigner for ur kind of work.
Btw, I used to wear a Skågen just like that one. Nice taste. Wear it in good health.
